column4: I'm trying to get my laptop to connect to a wireless network using a noname pcmcia card. The card shows up on lshw, but it's not in my network device list. Any idea what I might be doing wrong?
if you do "sudo lshw -C network" what is the card/chipset? Please pastebin your results.
I can't paste since I'm on another pc, but under product it says "88w8335 [Libertas]" and the vendor is Marvell
Well your in luck then--I know for sure that chipset works with ndiswrapper. Do you need help getting it going with ndiswrapper?
Do you have a link to a tutorial or something like that?
And I'd need to get the drivers somewhere first, right?

I guess not, but I can lead you through it if you like. And yes, you need the Windows wireless drivers, but I can help with that--you have exactly the same chipset 88w8335 as I do so I could send them to you if you like.
Yes, that'd be great!
I probably don't have the ports forwarded to do DCC, let me see if I can find them myself
Do you have a install CD for your wireless card? That would have the drivers on it.
I think the laptop still has a partition with WinXP on it, so they should probably be somewhere on there, right?
Hmmm, yes that's probably true, but you don't know how old they are. How about PMing me with an email address I can send it too?
OK I sent it--you should probably have it by now.
Oh wait...
OK that should have worked. Let me know when you get it.
nothing so far...
can you tell me the name of the inf file? Then I'll just check my windows installation for it

Oh brother the email bounced back at me because your gmail thinks I'm sending you an executable. Do you have any other email addresses? Or does anyone here know how to convert a bin to ascii temporarily?
OK this is better, just go here: http://drop.io/8nizsek
Did you get it OK now?
Yeah, I got it and already installed it with ndisgtk. Seems to work!
Excellent! Be sure to reboot and make sure it works on reboot too...
Looks like everything works, thanks for your help!
Great! Glad it's working.
